availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elizabeth Ray Tredaway (Clay County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, resident. Daughter of James Ray. Married to Robert Peter Tredaway. Mother of Sarah Tredaway, W.B. Tredaway, Minerva J. Tredaway, James M. Tredaway, Robert Tredaway, Amy Tredaway, and John Tredaway. Resident of Clay County in 1850. Resident of Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky, p. 113A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, District 1, p. 161A.
Ray, James (1853), Estate Papers, Madison County, North Carolina. Raleigh, North Carolina State Archives, Folder 3.
